title: How to Draw Justin Bieber

steps.headline: Start with a circle.
Add the outline sketch for the jawline.
Add the facial features outline sketches.
Draw the actual lines for the ears and the jawline.
Draw the facial features.
steps.description: Justin Bieber's eyes are slightly narrowed. Maybe it's one of his mannerisms because he always narrows his eyes but it suits him though.

steps.headline: Add the outline sketches for the famous Bieber hairstyle.
Draw the skeleton outline sketch for the body pose.
steps.description: We are drawing a caricature so we will have to draw his tiny body as well. However, drawing caricatures does not always require tiny bodies, what it requires is the likeness of the drawing to the subject and the subject's characteristics. One technique in showing the likeness is targeting the most dominant characteristic of the subject. His fashion, his hairstyle, his accessories, favorite color and so on.

steps.headline: Add the flesh.
Start drawing the actual lines for the clothes.
Erase the unnecessary outline sketches.
Erase the unnecessary lines.
Add thicker lines on all the edges to make it look more “cartoonish”.
Finish the actual lines.
Fill in the basic colors.
Add the highlights and shadows.
Add the background.
Start the outline sketches for the head and the face.
Add the outline sketches for the hair, face and shoulders.
Draw the outline from the forehead to the jawline.
Add the actual lines for one eyebrow and nose.
Add the actual lines for the left eyebrow.
Start drawing the actual lines of the eyes by drawing the upper eyelid.
Draw the lower eyelid.
Add the irises and pupil.
Add the eyelashes.
Draw the outline sketches for the mouth.
Continue with the neck.
Add the actual line for the ear.
Add the actual lines for the hair.
steps.description: Justin Bieber changed his hairstyle from his trademark look.

steps.headline: Draw the outline sketches for the clothes.
Erase the outline sketches.
Fill in the basic colors.
Add the highlights and shadows for the eyes and brows.
Start coloring the hair with the lightest color.
Continue with brown.
steps.description: Always keep in mind that in coloring the hair, the lines should always conform to the hair strands.

steps.headline: Add dark brown hair strands for the shadow to finish the hair.
steps.description: It is easier to adjust when coloring the hair if you start from the light or bright colors first to the dark colors.

steps.headline: Add the shadows on the skin.
Continue with the highlights on the skin.
Add the basic color of the mouth.
steps.description: Each part of the subject's features has to be drawn in detail to make the realistic approach in drawing.

steps.headline: Add the highlights and shadows.
Color the clothes with its highlights and shadows to show the texture as well.
Add the background.
Draw a large, vertical oval.
Add guidelines.
steps.description: Draw one halfway down the face, three quarters of the way down the face, and 7/8 of the way down the face. Also draw two lines for the neck.

steps.headline: Draw his eyes directly below the highest guideline.
steps.description: Then, add two lines for his shoulders.

steps.headline: Outline his hair.
steps.description: Draw the nose, beginning at the second guideline. Finally, draw eyebrows just above the first guideline.

steps.headline: Draw the outline of his classic haircut.
steps.description: Draw lips at the last guideline. Also add a shirt collar.

steps.headline: Add the rest of the details.
Erase guidelines.
Color.

tyn: Felt pen acrylics or crayons and ruler
text: Justin Bieber Caricature Start with a circle.  Add the outline sketch for the jawline.  Add the facial features outline sketches.  Draw the actual lines for the ears and the jawline.  Draw the facial features. Justin Bieber's eyes are slightly narrowed. Maybe it's one of his mannerisms because he always narrows his eyes but it suits him though. Add the outline sketches for the famous Bieber hairstyle.  Draw the skeleton outline sketch for the body pose. We are drawing a caricature so we will have to draw his tiny body as well. However, drawing caricatures does not always require tiny bodies, what it requires is the likeness of the drawing to the subject and the subject's characteristics. One technique in showing the likeness is targeting the most dominant characteristic of the subject. His fashion, his hairstyle, his accessories, favorite color and so on. Add the flesh.  Start drawing the actual lines for the clothes.  Erase the unnecessary outline sketches.  Erase the unnecessary lines.  Add thicker lines on all the edges to make it look more “cartoonish”.  Finish the actual lines.  Fill in the basic colors.  Add the highlights and shadows.  Add the background.  Realistic Justin Bieber Start the outline sketches for the head and the face.  Add the outline sketches for the hair, face and shoulders.  Draw the outline from the forehead to the jawline.  Add the actual lines for one eyebrow and nose.  Add the actual lines for the left eyebrow.  Start drawing the actual lines of the eyes by drawing the upper eyelid.  Draw the lower eyelid.  Add the irises and pupil.  Add the eyelashes.  Draw the outline sketches for the mouth.  Continue with the neck.  Add the actual line for the ear.  Add the actual lines for the hair. Justin Bieber changed his hairstyle from his trademark look. Draw the outline sketches for the clothes.  Erase the outline sketches.  Fill in the basic colors.  Add the highlights and shadows for the eyes and brows.  Start coloring the hair with the lightest color.  Continue with brown. Always keep in mind that in coloring the hair, the lines should always conform to the hair strands. Add dark brown hair strands for the shadow to finish the hair. It is easier to adjust when coloring the hair if you start from the light or bright colors first to the dark colors. Add the shadows on the skin.  Continue with the highlights on the skin.  Add the basic color of the mouth. Each part of the subject's features has to be drawn in detail to make the realistic approach in drawing. Add the highlights and shadows.  Color the clothes with its highlights and shadows to show the texture as well.  Add the background.  A Sketch Style Justin Bieber Draw a large, vertical oval.  Add guidelines. Draw one halfway down the face, three quarters of the way down the face, and 7/8 of the way down the face. Also draw two lines for the neck. Draw his eyes directly below the highest guideline. Then, add two lines for his shoulders. Outline his hair. Draw the nose, beginning at the second guideline. Finally, draw eyebrows just above the first guideline. Draw the outline of his classic haircut. Draw lips at the last guideline. Also add a shirt collar. Add the rest of the details.  Erase guidelines.  Color.
